3.50 
Dissolution of the marriage due to the death of one of the spouses 
1. The marriage shall end when one of the spouses dies or is declared dead by a court decision. 
2. If a spouse is declared dead, the marriage shall be deemed to have ended as from the date of the entry into force of the court decision or as from the date of death of the person specified in the court decision. 
3. If the spouse declared dead by the court decision is restored, the marriage may be resumed after the court decision has been reversed, on the joint application of both spouses to the civil registry office which registered the end of the marriage. 
4. The marriage may not be renewed if the other spouse has contracted a new marriage or if there are the obstacles provided for in Articles 3.12 to 3.17 of this Code.
